definitions.definition: a public official appointed to decide cases in a court of law.
examples: justice, magistrate, sheriff, jurist the judge sentenced him to five years

definitions.definition: a person who decides the results of a competition or watches for infractions of the rules.
examples: adjudicator, arbiter, arbitrator, assessor, evaluator, referee, ombudsman, ombudsperson, appraiser, examiner, moderator, mediator a panel of judges will select the winner

definitions.definition: a person able or qualified to give an opinion on something.
examples: she was a good judge of character
synonyms: mediator "a panel of judges will select the winner"

definitions.definition: a leader having temporary authority in ancient Israel in the period between Joshua and the kings.
form an opinion or conclusion about.
examples: scientists were judged according to competence
synonyms: figure "we judged that it was too late to proceed"

examples: other cases were judged by tribunal
synonyms: give a verdict on "the case was judged by a tribunal"

definitions.definition: give a verdict on (someone) in court.
examples: she was judged innocent of murder
synonyms: find "she was judged innocent of murder"

examples: adjudicate, arbitrate, mediate, moderate More"the competition will be judged by last year's winner"assess, appraise, evaluate; examine, review "entries were judged by a panel of experts"Morethe competition will be judged by last year's winnerassess, appraise, evaluate; examine, review entries were judged by a panel of experts
